traceability.evidence:
CLI support: `bin/dry-aged-deps.js` help text includes --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, --dev-severity flags. parseOptions in `src/cli-options.js` invokes parseProdMinAgeFlag, parseDevMinAgeFlag, parseProdSeverityFlag, parseDevSeverityFlag with correct precedence (CLI > config > default). `src/config-loader.js` validates `config.prod.minAge`, `config.prod.minSeverity`, `config.dev.minAge`, `config.dev.minSeverity`. `src/print-outdated.js` uses `loadPackageJson()` to detect dependency type and includes a 'Type' column in table output. JSON output includes `type` field via `prepareJsonItems` and `json-formatter.js`.
Tests: - `test/cli-options-helpers.test.js` covers parsing and validation of `--prod-min-age`, `--dev-min-age`, `--prod-severity`, `--dev-severity` flags. - `test/cli.config-file.test.js` verifies config file nested `prod` and `dev` objects override values. - `test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js` confirms table output shows correct `prod` type. - `test/printOutdated.json.test.js` verifies JSON output carries correct `thresholds.prod.minAge/devMinAge` and `type` field for packages. - `test/cli.flags.test.js` ensures fallback from general `--min-age` to both prod/dev thresholds.
All acceptance criteria satisfied and tested.
traceability.notes: The implementation fully supports separate production vs development thresholds via both CLI flags and config file, correctly detects dependency type, falls back to general flags, validates inputs, and clearly indicates dependency type in outputs. Comprehensive unit, integration, and CLI tests confirm behavior.
